law.catch_line: Limitation on charges for collision damage waivers that renters of motor vehicles may pay.

text.section:
Sec. 8A-1. Limitation on charges for collision damage waivers that renters of motor vehicles may pay.
Definition. Collision damage waiver ("CDW") means any product a consumer purchases from a car rental company in order to waive all or part of his or her liability in the event of a collision, other damage to, or loss due to theft of, a rental vehicle.
Limitation on price of collision damage waiver. No person or corporation which rents a private passenger motor vehicle to another person or corporation may, in a rental agreement of thirty (30) continuous days or less, sell or offer to sell a collision damage waiver at a price higher than the actual cost to cover the terms and conditions expressed in said waiver.
